Here is a quick and dirty rundown of what you can do with HeeksCNC currently.
= Introduction =
This is just a quick introduction to some of HeeksCNC's current capabilities.



= Details =
I found that Qcad to Heeks is a good method for making toolpaths.

1. You can take text in qcad and explode it into letters- then explode the letters into line segments

2. Then save as a dxf file and import into HeeksCAD

http://heekscnc.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/ddfalck/engraving.png

You can profile inside or outside shapes and choose which sections to cut

http://heekscnc.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/ddfalck/start_stop.png 


Surfacing in HeeksCNC uses Pycam python libraries to do 'dropcutter' paths on solids:
